de.nec.nle.siafu.graphics
Class Painter

java.lang.Object
  de.nec.nle.siafu.graphics.Painter

public class Painter
extends Object

This class handles the actual drawing on the simulation's canvas for most of the simulator's graphics. A notable exception are Markers, which draw themselves.

Author:
Miquel Martin

Method Detail

makePaletteDirect

public org.eclipse.swt.graphics.ImageData makePaletteDirect(org.eclipse.swt.graphics.ImageData originalData)
Turn the background image into an image with a direct palette. By the way, PNG's can have indexed palettes, and Windows will keep that when you draw on it. Linux, on the other hand, will treat any PNG as direct palette (non=indexed). Since we are drawing overlays on top of the original image, we definitelly need more colors than the original image has.

Parameters:
originalData - the original picture, potentially with a direct palette
Returns:
a new ImageData where the pixel values correspond to RGB values, instead of the original, indexed one. If the original palette was already direct, the ImageData you get back is still a copy of the original

paintBackground

public void paintBackground(org.eclipse.swt.graphics.GC gc)
Draw the background image (darkened it it's late at night) or the background plus an overlay if the user is requesting it.

Parameters:
gc - the GC on which to draw

getAgentSprite

public Sprite getAgentSprite(Agent a)
Get the sprite for a particular agent. This is derived from the agent's image.

Parameters:
a - the agent whose sprite we need
Returns:
the agent's sprite

getBounds

Get the bounds of the background.

Returns:
a Rectangle with the bounds.

paintMarkers

public void paintMarkers(org.eclipse.swt.graphics.GC gc,
                         Markers markers)
Ask all the markers to draw themselves with the given GC.

Parameters:
gc - the GC on which to draw
markers - the Markers object with all of the simulation's markers

requestOverlayDrawing

public void requestOverlayDrawing(Overlayable ov)
Called by the controller, this method draws the overlay on top of the background, and keep the image ready to be painted on the canvas instead of the background.

Parameters:
ov - the overlay that needs drawing

cancelOverlayDrawing

public void cancelOverlayDrawing()
Destroy the overlay+background image. The painter will now resume drawing the background.

disposeResources

public void disposeResources()
Destroy all SWT allocated resources.
